Bound HTML layout element to manipulate its attributes
; Typical triggers fired by this widget: ; (web)trigger OnClick ; (web)trigger OnDblClick ; (web)trigger OnFocus ; (web)trigger OnKeyPress ; webtrigger OnBlur

webtrigger detail ; Clears the retrieved occurrences from the current entity. ; Code is executed at the web client. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as child of the entity to be cleared ; 2. Because this field is static, you can define its Html element in the layout outside of the occurrence repetition, ; so that it does not repeat with occurrence repetition, like: ;
;
;
; ... ;
;
scope output endscope javascript var vField = this; var vOccurrence = vField.getParent(); var vEntity = vOccurrence.getParent(); vEntity.clear(); endjavascript end
Button to clear retrieved data on the client

webtrigger detail ; Clears the retrieved occurrences from the current entity. ; Code is executed at the web client. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as child of the entity to be cleared ; 2. Because this field is static, you can define its HTML element in the layout outside of the occurrence repetition, ; so that it is not repeated with each occurrence: ;
;
;
; ... ;
;
scope output endscope javascript var vField = this; var vOccurrence = vField.getParent(); var vEntity = vOccurrence.getParent(); vEntity.clear(); endjavascript end

trigger detail ; Clears the retrieved occurrences from the entity. ; Code executed on the server. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control ; 2. Because this field is static, you can define its Html element in the layout outside of the occurrence repetition, ; so that it does not repeat with occurrence repetition, like: ;
;
;
; ... ;
;
public web scope output endscope clear/e "<$entname>" end
Button to clear retrieved data on the server

trigger detail ; Clears the retrieved occurrences from the entity. ; Code executed on the server. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control. ; 2. Because this field is static, you can define its HTML element in the layout outside of the occurrence repetition, ; so that it is not repeated with each occurrence: ;
;
;
; ... ;
;
public web scope output endscope clear/e "<$entname>" end

webtrigger detail ; Creates a new occurrence after current occurrence of the current entity. ; Code is executed on the web client. ; Notes: Do not use client-side occurrence generation when certain data integrity rules need to be maintained! ; Technical key generation should always occur on the server. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control ; 2. Define the Html element for this field within the occurrence repetition, like: ;
; ... ;
; ... ;
scope input output endscope javascript var vField = this; var vOccurrence = vField.getParent(); vOccurrence.insertNewBefore(); endjavascript end
Button to create occurrence on the client

webtrigger detail ; Creates a new occurrence after the current occurrence of the current entity. ; Code is executed on the web client. ; Notes: Do not use client-side occurrence generation when certain data integrity rules need to be maintained! ; Technical key generation should always occur on the server. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control. ; 2. Define the HTML element for this field within the occurrence repetition: ;
; ... ;
; ... ;
scope input output endscope javascript var vField = this; var vOccurrence = vField.getParent(); vOccurrence.insertNewBefore(); endjavascript end

trigger detail ; Creates a new occurrence after current occurrence of the current entity. ; Code executed on the server. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control ; 2. Define the Html element for this field within the occurrence repetition, like: ;
; ... ;
; ... ;
public web scope input output endscope creocc "<$entname>", $curocc("<$entname>") ; Insert code to generate any technical keys, e.g. ; KEYFIELD.<$entname> = $uuid end
Button to create occurrence on the server

trigger detail ; Creates a new occurrence after the current occurrence of the current entity. ; Code executed on the server. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control. ; 2. Define the HTML element for this field within the occurrence repetition: ;
; ... ;
; ... ;
public web scope input output endscope creocc "<$entname>", $curocc("<$entname>") ; Insert code to generate any technical keys, e.g. ; KEYFIELD.<$entname> = $uuid end

webtrigger detail ; Marks the current current occurrence for deletion, actual deletion occurs on store. ; Code is executed on the web client. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control ; 2. Define the Html element for this field within the occurrence repetition, like: ;
; ... ;
; ... ;
scope input output endscope javascript var vField = this; var vOccurrence = vField.getParent(); vOccurrence.remove(); endjavascript end
Button to remove occurrence on the client

webtrigger detail ; Marks the current current occurrence for deletion; actual deletion occurs upon store. ; Code is executed on the web client. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control. ; 2. Define the HTML element for this field within the occurrence repetition: ;
; ... ;
; ... ;
scope input output endscope javascript var vField = this; var vOccurrence = vField.getParent(); vOccurrence.remove(); endjavascript end

trigger detail ; Marks the current current occurrence for deletion, actual deletion occurs on store. ; Code is executed on the server. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control ; 2. Define the Html element for this field within the occurrence repetition, like: ;
; ... ;
; ... ;
public web scope input output endscope remocc "<$entname>", 0 end
Button to remove occurrence on the server

trigger detail ; Marks the current current occurrence for deletion, actual deletion occurs upon store. ; Code is executed on the server. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control. ; 2. Define the HTML element for this field within the occurrence repetition: ;
; ... ;
; ... ;
public web scope input output endscope remocc "<$entname>", 0 end

trigger detail ; Retrieves data from database and loads them as occurrences into the entity. ; Code is executed on the server. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control ; 2. Because this field is static, you can define its Html element in the layout outside of the occurrence repetition, ; so that it does not repeat with occurrence repetition, like: ;
;
;
; ... ;
;
public web variables string vProfiles endvariables #ifdefined option_1 ; Optionally copy a single ooccurrence from an other entity to be used as profile input clear/e "<$entname>" putlistitems/occ vProfiles, "PROFILE_ENTITY" getlistitems/occ/init vProfiles, "<$entname>" #endif ; Retrieve data from database retrieve/e "<$entname>" selectcase $procerror case 0 ; ok case -2, -4 webmessage/info "Retrieve: No data found in the database." elsecase webmessage/error "Retrieve: Error occurred - (%%($procerror))." endselectcase return 0 end
Button to retrieve data from the database

trigger detail ; Retrieves data from database and loads it as occurrences into the entity. ; Code is executed on the server. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control. ; 2. Because this field is static, you can define its HTML element in the layout outside of the occurrence repetition, ; so that it is not repeated with each occurrence: ;
;
;
; ... ;
;
public web variables string vProfiles endvariables #ifdefined option_1 ; Optionally copy a single occurrence from another entity to be used as profile input clear/e "<$entname>" putlistitems/occ vProfiles, "PROFILE_ENTITY" getlistitems/occ/init vProfiles, "<$entname>" #endif ; Retrieve data from database retrieve/e "<$entname>" selectcase $procerror case 0 ; ok case -2, -4 webmessage/info "Retrieve: No data found in the database." elsecase webmessage/error "Retrieve: Error occurred - (%%($procerror))." endselectcase return 0 end

trigger detail ; Stores occurrences that are modified into the database and deletes any occurrences marked for deletion from the database. ; Code is executed on the server. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control ; 2. Optionally, define a component variable of type struct and report any validation errors to it in the entity and field 'error' triggers. ; Define a constant DATAERRORS with the name of this component variable. ; 3. Because this field is static, you can define its Html element in the layout outside of the occurrence repetition, ; so that it does not repeat with occurrence repetition, like: ;
;
;
; ... ;
;
public web scope input output endscope ; Initialize message frame so we can use it for a store log clrmess #ifdefined DATAERRORS ; Initialize a component variable holding the data validation error as reported by the entity and field error triggers ; Note that this needs to be done before store initiation. ; (See 'trigger error' snippets for DSPs) = $newstruct ->$name = "Data validation errors" #endif ; Initiate the store store/e "<$entname>" selectcase $status case 0 ; Store successful -> report putmess "Store successful." commit selectcase $procerror case 0 ; Commit successful -> report putmess "Commit successful." ; Instruct browser to show the store log webmessage/info $putmess elsecase ; Commit failed -> report putmess "Commit failed ($procerror=%%($procerror))." rollback ; Instruct browser to show the store log webmessage/error $putmess endselectcase case 1 ; No modifications -> report ; Instruct browser to show the error log webmessage/warning "No modifications." elsecase ; store failed -> report $procerror (more information also available in $procerrorcontext) putmess "Store failed ($procerror=%%($procerror))." #ifdefined DATAERRORS ; Also report the validation errors that might have been reported in putmess ->$dbgstring #endif ; Perfromm rollback rollback selectcase $procerror case 0 ; rollback ok putmess "Rollback successful." elsecase ; rollback also failed putmess "Rollback failed ($procerror=%%($procerror))." endselectcase ; Instruct browser to show the error log webmessage/error $putmess endselectcase return 0 end
Button to save data into the database

trigger detail ; Stores occurrences that are modified into the database and deletes any occurrences marked for deletion from the database. ; Code is executed on the server. ; TO DO: ; 1. Define this field in the structure as a child of the entity it needs to control. ; 2. Optionally, define a component variable of type struct and report any validation errors to it in the error triggers of the entity and field. ; Define a constant DATAERRORS with the name of this component variable. ; 3. Because this field is static, you can define its HTML element in the layout outside of the occurrence repetition, ; so that it is not repeated with each occurrence: ;
;
;
; ... ;
;
public web scope input output endscope ; Initialize message frame so it can be used for logging clrmess #ifdefined DATAERRORS ; Initialize a component variable holding the data validation error, as reported by the entity and field error triggers ; Note that this needs to be done before store initiation. ; (See 'trigger error' snippets for DSPs) = $newstruct ->$name = "Data validation errors" #endif ; Initiate the store store/e "<$entname>" selectcase $status case 0 ; Store successful -> report putmess "Store successful." commit selectcase $procerror case 0 ; Commit successful -> report putmess "Commit successful." ; Instruct browser to show the store log webmessage/info $putmess elsecase ; Commit failed -> report putmess "Commit failed ($procerror=%%($procerror))." rollback ; Instruct browser to show the store log webmessage/error $putmess endselectcase case 1 ; No modifications -> report ; Instruct browser to show the error log webmessage/warning "No modifications." elsecase ; store failed -> report $procerror (more information also available in $procerrorcontext) putmess "Store failed ($procerror=%%($procerror))." #ifdefined DATAERRORS ; Also report the validation errors that might have been reported in putmess ->$dbgstring #endif ; Perfromm rollback rollback selectcase $procerror case 0 ; rollback ok putmess "Rollback successful." elsecase ; rollback also failed putmess "Rollback failed ($procerror=%%($procerror))." endselectcase ; Instruct browser to show the error log webmessage/error $putmess endselectcase return 0 end
